title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement contact details DESCRIPTION file. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Pepijn de Vries. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: de Vries P (2025). CopernicusClimate: Search Download Handle Data Copernicus Climate Data Service. R package version 0.0.1, https://pepijn-devries.github.io/CopernicusClimate/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {CopernicusClimate: Search Download and Handle Data from Copernicus Climate Data Service},   author = {Pepijn {de Vries}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://pepijn-devries.github.io/CopernicusClimate/}, }

title: Search Download and Handle Data from Copernicus Climate Data Service
text: Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S) mission providing information past, present future climate, well tools enable climate change mitigation adaptation strategies. C3S Climate Data Store provides open state---art climate data scientists. package allows users download data data store handle R.

title: Search Download and Handle Data from Copernicus Climate Data Service
text: Install latest developmental version R-Universe:

title: Search Download and Handle Data from Copernicus Climate Data Service
text: order download data C3S first need submit request cds_submit_job(). request processed C3S, can download data cds_download_jobs(). workflow demonstrated code snippet .
code: library(CopernicusClimate) library(stars)   ## For loading spatial raster data library(ggplot2) ## For plotting the data  if (cds_token_works()) { ## Make sure there is an operational access token      ## Submit a download job:   job <-     cds_submit_job(       "sis-agrometeorological-indicators",       statistic = "day_time_mean",       variable = "2m_temperature",       year = "2025",       month = "01",       day = "01")      ## Actually download the data:   data_file <- cds_download_jobs(job$jobID, tempdir())      ## Unzip the downloaded data:   data_unzipped <- unzip(data_file$local, list = TRUE)   unzip(data_file$local, exdir = tempdir())   data_stars <- read_mdim(file.path(tempdir(), data_unzipped))      ## Plot the downloaded data   ggplot() +     geom_stars(data = data_stars) +     coord_sf() +     labs(fill = "T(air 2m) [K]", x = NULL, y = NULL) +     scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "inferno", na.value = "transparent") }

title: Search Download and Handle Data from Copernicus Climate Data Service
text: R packages exploring Copernicus data services: CopernicusClimate Dedicated marine datasets

title: Search Download and Handle Data from Copernicus Climate Data Service
text: Please note CopernicusClimate project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what: CopernicusClimate: Search Download and Handle Data from Copernicus Climate Data Service — CopernicusClimate-package
title: CopernicusClimate: Search Download and Handle Data from Copernicus Climate Data Service — CopernicusClimate-package
text: Subset download data EU Copernicus Climate Data Service: https://cds.climate.copernicus.eu/. Import information Earth's past, present future climate Copernicus R without need external software.

title: CopernicusClimate: Search Download and Handle Data from Copernicus Climate Data Service — CopernicusClimate-package
text: Maintainer: Pepijn de Vries pepijn.devries@outlook.com (ORCID)

title: Accept a specific licence — cds_accept_licence
text: Call function wish accept specific license.

Accept a specific licence — cds_accept_licence
text: license license id wish accept. revision revision number license accepting. always latest revision. ... Ignored token API key used authentication. use cds_get_token() default.

text: Returns data.frame containing accepted license

what: Prepare a request for downloading a dataset — cds_build_request
title: Prepare a request for downloading a dataset — cds_build_request
text: function used cds_estimate_costs() cds_submit_job() subset dataset downloading. also help explore parameters available subsetting.

title: Prepare a request for downloading a dataset — cds_build_request
Prepare a request for downloading a dataset — cds_build_request
text: dataset dataset name used setting request. ... Parameters subsetting dataset. Use cds_dataset_form() inquiry parameters parameter values available specific dataset. left blank take default parameter values.

title: Prepare a request for downloading a dataset — cds_build_request
text: Returns named list, can used submit job (cds_submit_job()) inquiry cost (cds_estimate_costs()).

title: Prepare a request for downloading a dataset — cds_build_request
code: if (interactive()) {   cds_build_request(     dataset        = "reanalysis-era5-pressure-levels",     variable       = "geopotential",     product_type   = "reanalysis",     area           = c(n = 55, w = -1, s = 50, e = 10),     year           = "2024",     month          = "03",     day            = "01",     pressure_level = "1000",     data_format    = "netcdf"   ) }

what: Delete/cancel jobs submitted to the Climate Data Service — cds_delete_job
title: Delete/cancel jobs submitted to the Climate Data Service — cds_delete_job
text: Whe regret submitting job, can cancel calling function.

title: Delete/cancel jobs submitted to the Climate Data Service — cds_delete_job
Delete/cancel jobs submitted to the Climate Data Service — cds_delete_job
text: job_id Hexadecimal code used identifier job. Identifies job cancelled. ... Ignored token API key used authentication. use cds_get_token() default.

title: Delete/cancel jobs submitted to the Climate Data Service — cds_delete_job
text: Returns data.frame information cancelled job.

title: Delete/cancel jobs submitted to the Climate Data Service — cds_delete_job
code: if (interactive() && cds_token_works()) {   job <- cds_submit_job(       dataset        = "reanalysis-era5-pressure-levels",       variable       = "geopotential",       product_type   = "reanalysis",       area           = c(n = 55, w = -1, s = 50, e = 10),       year           = "2024",       month          = "03",       day            = "01",       pressure_level = "1000",       data_format    = "netcdf"     )   cds_delete_job(job$jobID, tempdir()) }

title: Download specific jobs — cds_download_jobs
text: submitting one jobs cds_submit_job(), can download resulting files cds_download_jobs()

title: Download specific jobs — cds_download_jobs
Download specific jobs — cds_download_jobs
text: job_id specific job identifier listed , files resulting jobs downloaded. left blank, successful jobs downloaded. destination Destination path store downloaded files. names File names downloaded files. missing, cryptic hexadecimal file name taken job. ... Ignored token API key used authentication. use cds_get_token() default.

title: Download specific jobs — cds_download_jobs
text: data.frame downloaded files. Contains column local path locally stored files.

title: Download specific jobs — cds_download_jobs
code: if (interactive() && cds_token_works()) {   job <- cds_submit_job(       dataset        = "reanalysis-era5-pressure-levels",       variable       = "geopotential",       product_type   = "reanalysis",       area           = c(n = 55, w = -1, s = 50, e = 10),       year           = "2024",       month          = "03",       day            = "01",       pressure_level = "1000",       data_format    = "netcdf"     )   cds_download_jobs(job$jobID, tempdir()) }

what: Check the cost of a request against your quota — cds_estimate_costs
title: Check the cost of a request against your quota — cds_estimate_costs
text: account limit amount data can downloaded. Use function check request exceeds quota.

title: Check the cost of a request against your quota — cds_estimate_costs

text: dataset dataset name inspected ... Parameters passed cds_build_request() token API key used authentication. use cds_get_token() default.

title: Check the cost of a request against your quota — cds_estimate_costs
text: Returns named list indicating available quota estimated cost request specified ...-arguments.

title: Check the cost of a request against your quota — cds_estimate_costs
code: if (interactive() && cds_token_works()) {   cds_estimate_costs(     dataset        = "reanalysis-era5-pressure-levels",     variable       = "geopotential",     product_type   = "reanalysis",     area           = c(n = 55, w = -1, s = 50, e = 10),     year           = "2024",     month          = "03",     day            = "01",     pressure_level = "1000",     data_format    = "netcdf"   )      cds_estimate_costs(dataset = "reanalysis-era5-pressure-levels") }

text: use API key, first need get one Climate Data Service. can , creating account initialise key https://cds.climate.copernicus.eu/profile. diffrent locations key can stored cds_get_token() look. look first succecful value (order): environment variable named "CDSAPI_KEY", R getOption() named "CDSAPI_KEY", environment variable named "ECMWF_DATASTORES_KEY", R getOption() named "ECMWF_DATASTORES_KEY". can set key start R session cds_set_token(). want persistent sollution, can add environment variable (names shown ) system. can add option (names shown ) ".profile" file. help obscure sensitive account information R script.

what: Submit a download job for a dataset — cds_submit_job
title: Submit a download job for a dataset — cds_submit_job
text: Submit request Copernicus Climate Data Service download (part ) dataset. request successful, job identifier returned can used actually download data (cds_download_jobs()).

title: Submit a download job for a dataset — cds_submit_job
code: cds_submit_job(   dataset,   ...,   wait = TRUE,   check_quota = TRUE,   check_licence = TRUE,   token = cds_get_token() )

title: Submit a download job for a dataset — cds_submit_job
text: dataset dataset name downloaded ... Subsetting parameters passed onto cds_build_request(). wait logical value indicating function wait submitted job finish. Set FALSE continue without waiting check_quota account quota data can downloaded. argument set TRUE (default) checked request exceed quota. Set FALSE skip step speed submission. check_licence Datasets generally require accept certain terms use. argument set TRUE (default), checked accepted required licences submitted request. Set FALSE skip step speed submission. token API key used authentication. use cds_get_token() default.

title: Submit a download job for a dataset — cds_submit_job
text: Returns data.frame containing information submitted job.

title: Submit a download job for a dataset — cds_submit_job
code: if (interactive() && cds_token_works()) {   job <- cds_submit_job(       dataset        = "reanalysis-era5-pressure-levels",       variable       = "geopotential",       product_type   = "reanalysis",       area           = c(n = 55, w = -1, s = 50, e = 10),       year           = "2024",       month          = "03",       day            = "01",       pressure_level = "1000",       data_format    = "netcdf"     ) }
